title: No, George Soros did not say he funded “black hate groups” to destroy the US
subtitle: A meme
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
in South Africa attributes a quote about supporting “black hate groups” to billionaire financier and philanthropist

It claims Soros told the German newspaper Bild the following in September 2014: “I’m going to bring down the United States by funding black hate groups. We’ll put them into a mental trap and make them blame white people. The black community is the easiest to manipulate.”

The meme, which shows a photo of Soros, was shared on a number of

recently debunked fake quotes associated with other famous personalities such as South Africa’s former public protector

and first president of the US,

Like these, the George Soros attribution is also false.

No evidence of Soros saying this

According to US fact-checking site

statement from Soros “does not appear in the [Bild] newspaper’s

for September 2014 (or any other month)”.

In addition, no other credible news site ever reported on Soros’s alleged hateful message. If Soros had made the remarks they would have been circulated by reputable news organisations.

It is unusual for such remarks to go unreported.

This was not the first time a fake quote (not) made by Soros has been shared online.
